articles.title: Bun 1.2: A Big Step Forward for the Fast JS/TS Runtime
articles.description: The JavaScriptCore-based Bun continues to up its server-side runtime game with strides forward in Node.js compatibility, performance boosts, and new APIs for interacting with S3 and S3-like object stores as well as Postgres. If you‚Äôd prefer to be ‚ñ∂Ô∏è introduced to Bun 1.2 with a keynote-style video, it's a good watch.
articles.author: Ashcon Partovi and the Bun Team

articles.title: ü§ñ¬†Transformers.js v3.3: Machine Learning and AI for the Web
articles.description: This is a dry release announcement but I wanted to highlight the rapid pace that this exciting library is making for browser-based NLP, speech recognition, vision, and now text-to-speech use cases (live TTS demo here - it takes a while to load though). It‚Äôs also being used in Firefox for various enhancements (see below).
articles.author: Hugging Face

articles.title: üïí¬†JavaScript Temporal is Coming (For Real!)
articles.description: We first mentioned the Temporal API proposal providing a better way to handle dates and times in JavaScript almost five years ago (in issue 496!) but now it really is almost here. Brian explains its basic concepts and where initial support is starting to appear.
articles.author: Brian Smith

articles.title: Avoiding anys with Linting and TypeScript
articles.description: any is TypeScript‚Äôs famous type fallback/safety hatch but if you can avoid it, you can benefit more from TypeScript‚Äôs type-checking features. Josh shares some tips to do just that.
articles.author: Josh Goldberg

articles.title: ü§ñ¬†Running Inference in Web Extensions
articles.description: Firefox Nightly is shipping with a new API that can let you use their AI runtime for offline machine learning tasks in Web extensions you create. It uses the previously mentioned Transformers.js and is already used in Firefox 133 to provide alt text for images in PDFs.
articles.author: Tarek Ziad√© (Mozilla)

articles.title: deck.gl 9.1: GPU-Powered Large Scale Data Visualization
articles.description: deck.gl provides a way to create complex yet high performance data visualizations composed of multiple layers (examples). It can be used in a vanilla JS way or through React components and it‚Äôs ready for WebGPU.
articles.author: OpenJS Foundation

articles.title: ArkType 2.0: Runtime Validation Library
articles.description: An easy-to-deploy solution for schema validation that can infer TypeScript definitions 1:1 and use them as optimized validators for your data, both at runtime and for immediate type-level feedback in your editor.
articles.author: ArkType

articles.title: NodeBB v4.0.0 Released: Node.js Powered Forums
articles.description: Offers a classic forum experience in a modern Node.js-shaped guise. v4 adds support for federation between instances and the wider 'fediverse.'
articles.author: NodeBB, Inc.

articles.title: SRCL: Build React Apps with 'Terminal Aesthetics'
articles.description: The homepage is a live demonstration of what SRCL has to offer. It‚Äôs a suite of React components and styling to recreate a monospaced, terminal-like atmosphere
articles.author: Internet Development Studio Company

articles.title: üé∂¬†Chiptune.js: Module / Tracker File Player
articles.description: A library for playing ‚Äòmodule‚Äô music files like MOD, XM and S3M. (Demo.)
articles.author: Chiptune Contributors

articles.description: The creator of SolidJS says that Angular and Vue are the frameworks to watch in 2025, while reflecting on JS framework progress generally.
A year ago, Kelly Sutton wrote about his company's move away from React but how did it pan out? In Moving On from React, a Year Later he explains how things have gone since.
JSON Query is a neat, flexible JSON querying language. The demos really sell it IMHO.
The ESLint project takes a look back at ESLint's 2024 year in review.
GitHub has unveiled sub-issues, issue types, and advanced search for issues.
Rspack v1.2 ‚Äì Fast Rust-based Web bundler adds a peristent cache feature that improves hot start performance by up to 250%.
Node v23.6.1 (Current), v22.13.1 (LTS), v20.18.2 (LTS), v18.20.6 (LTS) to resolve some security vulnerabilities.
Capacitor 7.0 ‚Äì Build cross-platform native apps/PWAs with web technologies.
React Native 0.77 ‚Äì Now with enhanced styling capabilities.
Vitest 3.0 ‚Äì The fast Vite-native testing framework.
NestJS 11, Storybook 8.5, Unpic 1.0, Inferno 9.0

articles.title: Six CSS Snippets Every Developer Should Know in¬†2025
articles.description: Adam shared a similar list last year and it proved incredibly popular ‚Äî as such, he‚Äôs back again with another grab bag of hefty snippets which are ‚Äúbigger, more powerful, and leverage progressive enhancement a bit more‚Äù.
articles.author: Adam Argyle

articles.title: ‚ù§Ô∏è¬†Top Pens of 2024 on CodePen
articles.description: Plenty of superb inspiration, demos, and neat tricks on show here. Whether that‚Äôs a neat parallax effect, a retro VHS look achieved with CSS, a rad web component that adds particles to your pointer, or this 3D image carousel. Lots of cool stuff to dig into.
articles.author: CodePen

articles.title: Cool People Link to Text Fragments
articles.description: Did you know that support for linking to text fragments is now enabled across all major browsers? It means you don‚Äôt need elements to have an ID in order to navigate to it, instead you can go directly to a specific text string. Chris briefly shows us how.
articles.author: Chris Coyier

articles.title: The UX of Login Codes
articles.description: Brad explores the often very real friction that‚Äôs found between offering a great user experience and great security, along with the challenges and compromises that come with delivering both. ‚ÄúIf your product texts/emails login codes, the experience better be amazing.‚Äù
articles.author: Brad Frost

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†What is the Shared Storage API?
articles.description: Tara Agyemang from the Chrome team talks us through why we need shared storage, its privacy benefits, common use cases, and how we can use it.
articles.author: Chrome for Developers

articles.title: 'My Website Has Been Gaslighting You'
articles.description: Quite the provocative headline! Dave has been changing his site ever so slightly every day, tweaking the CSS by setting a --hue variable and rotating the hue about 1deg each day to make it 360¬∫ around a color wheel over the year. A fun little experiment.
articles.author: Dave Rupert

articles.title: Avoid Multiple Page Redirects: How Redirects Impact Page Speed
articles.description: Redirects add in steps that can delay page load, in-turn affecting user experience and Core Web Vitals results. As such, this post looks at how to optimize redirects to ensure faster browsing for visitors.
articles.author: Conor McCarthy

articles.title: Don‚Äôt Wrap Figure in a Link
articles.description: Highlights the inconsistent and problematic behaviours such as practice can inflict on voice control users.
articles.author: Adrian Roselli

articles.title: Shapecatcher: Draw the Unicode Character You Want
articles.description: Looking for a specific Unicode character, or just something close enough to represent what you want? This is pretty neat. Draw a shape in the box and you get the closest matches, ready to copy and paste.
articles.author: Benjamin Milde

articles.title: TailwindCSS Snippets: A Small Collection of Unique Tailwind¬†Animations
articles.description: You can right-click each of the animations to copy the code or send the code to the official Tailwind playground, where you can live edit and customize as needed.
articles.author: Alexandru ≈¢urcanu

articles.title: Drupal CMS 1.0 Released
articles.description: The Drupal project is now 24 years old(!), and we now have two options for building with it ‚Äî the original Core experience, or this new ready-to-use platform.
articles.author: Dries Buytaert

articles.title: Data Viz Project: A Huge Collection of Data Visualizations
articles.description: Mostly for inspiration or when you‚Äôre not sure what type of chart or graph to use. Currently includes more than 160 types of visualizations under 5 main ‚Äòfamilies‚Äô.
articles.author: Ferdio
